src.data.features.travel

Helper functions for building engineered features for team travel.

src.data.features.travel.attach_lats_lons(games, city_coords)[source]

Merge the city coordinates onto the games dataframe.

Parameters:

  • games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_rows, n_cols)) – Raw games data.

  • city_coords (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_teams, n_cols)) – City coordinates data.

Returns:

Games dataframe with city coordinates attached.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_rows, n_cols)

src.data.features.travel.build_travel_features(raw_games_path, city_coords_path, output_dir)[source]

Build engineered features for team travel.

Parameters:

  • raw_games_path (str) – Path to the raw games data.

  • city_coords_path (str) – Path to the city coordinates data.

  • output_dir (str) – Path to the output directory.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

src.data.features.travel.calculate_distances(home_coords, away_coords)[source]

Calculates the distance between two arrays of lat/lon coordinate pairs.

Parameters:

  • home_coords (np.array of shape (n, 2)) – Home lat/lon coordinates.

  • away_coords (np.array of shape (n, 2)) – Away lat/lon coordinates.

Returns:

Distance between the two coordinates in km.

Return type:

np.array of shape (n, 1)

src.data.features.travel.get_away_lon_deltas(games, name)[source]

Calculate the difference in longitude between the home and away teams.

Parameters:

  • games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_rows, n_cols)) – Raw games data.

  • name (str) – Name of the travel feature.

Returns:

Dataframe with the away team longitude deltas.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_rows, n_cols)

src.data.features.travel.get_away_travel_distances(games, name)[source]

Calculate the distance traveled by the away team for each game.

Parameters:

  • games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_rows, n_cols)) – Raw games data.

  • name (str) – Name of the travel feature.

Returns:

Dataframe with the travel distances for each game.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_rows, n_cols)

src.data.features.travel.get_city_coordinates(teams, loc_replacements)[source]

Returns a dataframe with the decimal latitude and longitude for every NFL team city in the Sharpe teams data.

Mostly saving this just for reference. I only need to run it once.

Parameters:

  • teams (pd.DataFrame) – df with team names and locations

  • loc_replacements (dict) – dict of location replacements

Returns:

city names, latitudes, and longitudes

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
